alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Juniata; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN JUNIATA... SOUTHWESTERN PERRY AND NORTHWESTERN CUMBERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 609 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 15 miles north of Shippensburg, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Honey Grove, Spruce Hill, East Waterford, Colonel Denning State Park, Loysville, Ickesburg, Shermansdale, Perulack, Big Spring State Park, Blain, Landisburg and New Germantown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
